title: A debt collector left me a message saying there were trying to sue me. And I just looked online and saw this.
question: But the case says 2016. What does this mean? I was never served
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes,Default judgment
answers: You don't appear to know who has sued you, or for what, and in what amount. DO NOT let the creditor obtain a default judgment against you! Get down to the court and take a look at the file there. Then take copies of the file documents, as well as a copy of the "docket" from the court, to a local attorney ASAP. Good luck.

You need to actually go to the courthouse and look at the court's file. If there is a Proof of Service, stating that you were served, get a copy. Also, a copy of the Complaint. Then, consult an attorney who is experienced in defending debt collection cases.

You cannot wait until 2016 to take care of this. If the collector obtains a default judgment against you, which they may do at any time, the judgment will be entered and final, and future dates will go off calenar.
